text: I grew up during the Apollo era and even
though they didn't have any women
astronauts I thought that was the
dumbest thing in the world right because
women could do as well or better than
than men in this and in fact they did
there was a group called the mercury 13
who were tested it back in 1961-62 63
they did as well as a minute infected
many of the tests they actually blew the
men out of the water with isolation
tests and psychological tests amazing so
here's the thing i would have gone in
the space if there had never been
anybody of any kind going i would have
volunteer you know take me take me i
want to go and if there had been
thousands of people of every kind there
i would have still wanted to go as a
little girl I assumed I would always go
into space for me it was that connection
between who I am here on earth in my
connection with the greater universe I
remember being on orbit and looking down
and seeing the Nile Delta go past and I
remembered being at the pyramids before
and I realized that I belong anywhere in
this universe and I as much part of this
universe as any speck of Stardust any
comment any planet any star for me being
in space was a validation
